channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Atmospheric winds have surprising impact on ocean weather
item.description: U.S. National Science Foundation-supported researchers published a new paper that explains how atmospheric wind affects eddies, an ocean weather pheno...

item.title: How activity in Earth's mantle led the ancient ancestors of elephants, giraffes, and humans into Asia and Africa
item.description: What roils beneath the Earth's surface may feel a world away, but the activity can help forge land masses that dictate ocean circulation, climate patt...

item.title: Did it rain or snow on ancient Mars? New study suggests it did
item.description: Geologists weigh in on a long-running debate about Mars: Billions of years ago, was the Red Planet warm and wet or cold and dry?

item.title: What if Mother Earth could sue for mistreatment?
item.description: The study highlights the transformative potential of the Rights of Nature, which views nature as a rights-bearing entity, not merely an object of regu...

item.title: Wild chimps filmed sharing 'boozy' fruit
item.description: Wild chimpanzees have been pictured eating and sharing fruit containing alcohol.

item.title: High-fat, high-sugar diets impact cognitive function
item.description: New research links fatty, sugary diets to impaired brain function. The findings build on a growing body of evidence showing the negative impact of hig...

item.title: 10 billion Milky Way stars might have habitable exoplanets after all
item.description: A research team led by the recipient of a U.S. National Science Foundation Faculty Early Career Development grant used computer simulations to determi...

item.title: Molecular nanocages remove 80-90% of PFAS, or 'forever chemicals,' from water
item.description: Researchers funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation have created a molecular nanocage that captures the bulk of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substa...

item.title: NSF launches new sexual assault crisis helpline for research community
item.description: The U.S. National Science Foundation today launched a 24/7 crisis intervention helpline for members of the NSF research community who have experienced...

item.title: NSF expands access to advanced cloud computing for scientific research
